intro: Oberonia lipensis, commonly known as the Lippen's orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to the Philippines. It is characterized by its delicate, pendulous flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant has a short, branched rhizome and produces small, oval-shaped pseudobulbs that store water and nutrients. Its leaves are elongated and革质 (leathery), adapted to retain moisture in its natural habitat. Oberonia lipensis thrives in humid, shaded environments, often growing on trees in tropical rainforests.
